result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Sain, Laura M.
defendant.address: 751 County Road K, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54937

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance filed by Atty Taylor Soule

ADDRESS INFO for Laura M. Sain
Current: 751 County Road K, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54937 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 3570 Patti Dr 4, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant's personal appearance at the PTC is waived.
State is incompliance with victim rights notification.

3:22 PM Defendant Laura M. Sain appeared by video, in custody at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Laura M. Sain.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.
ADA Dodge would like to call the co-defendant.
Court will recall this case.

3:52 p.m.  Court recalls the case.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that she can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with her attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with her attorney.

3:53 p.m.  Detective J Lawrynk is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
Court asks that the defendant mute ZOOM on her end due to noise.
ADA Dodge continues his direct examination.
3:58 p.m. Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Dodge would ask that the record reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
The record so reflects the identification.
3:03 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Soule.
4:06 p.m.  ADA Dodge has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Dodge has no additional witnesses.
Atty Soule has no witnesses.
Neither party has any final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Restitution Summary/Joint & Several filed by the State

No contact with co-defendants, Laron Thomas and Lorenzo Miner
No contact with the victim, J.J.H.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

2:31 PM Defendant Laura M. Sain appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.   Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Laura M. Sain.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Record reflects that no victim appears today.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for August 22, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
